entries.name: Ingenuity
entries: In place of superpowers, you have only your clever mind to protect you. Fortunately, it is remarkable indeed. At 2nd level, whenever you make ability checks for the ability score associated with your mastermind strategy, you do so with advantage.

entries.name: Acquisitions
entries: At 5th level, you have acquired some advanced technological devices to help you toward your goals. Perhaps you are a brilliant inventor and you have created these items yourself. Or maybe your underground-economy connections have provided them for you. Regardless, you now have two hand-held devices that reproduce superpowered effects. Select two at will powers from any superpower list. They are Mastermind at will powers for you now, so use your power save DC and power attack modifier when you use them.
When you gain a Mastermind level, you can elect to change the superpower one or both of your devices can use, selecting other at will powers.

entries.name: Combat Advisor
entries: At 7th level, you understand your allies' strengths and weaknesses and can better prepare them for their next combat encounter. If you spend 1 minute advising your allies on how to fight more effectively, they become better prepared for the battle ahead. Each friendly creature that can hear you gains the benefit of a short rest, has advantage on their next initiative roll, and gains temporary HP equal to your Mastermind level.

entries.name: Minion Commander
entries: When you reach 10th level, your connection to your Minions strengthens. Now you may summon your Minions as a bonus action. Once you've summoned them, you may summon them again once you have completed a short or long rest. The total levels of Minions present and serving you still cannot exceed the number of levels in the Minion Levels column on your Mastermind table, however.

entries.name: Super Science
entries: Starting at 11th level, you gain heightened understanding of, or access to, high tech devices surpassing anything available to even the greatest earthly minds. You gain proficiency in Science and Technology if you did not have them before. If you already have such proficiency, you now roll these skills with Expertise, adding your proficiency bonus twice to your rolls.

With your newly invented or acquired scientific advancements, you now have two devices that can replicate the superhuman abilities of the superheroes and villains of the world. Describe two hand-held mundane devices and choose one 1st level power from any superpower list for each. Each device can use its associated power once, refreshing the ability to do so when you complete a short or long rest.
When you gain a Mastermind level, you can elect to change the superpower one or both of your devices can use, selecting other 1st level powers.
Furthermore, when you reach 18th level in this class, your ability to use these 1st level powers becomes reflexive, so you can use them at will.

entries.name: Minion Master
entries: When you reach 15th level, your connection to your Minions reaches its apex. Now, when you summon Minions, you may summon them to arrive at any location within 120 feet of you if the space is unoccupied.
Further, when they arrive, they may make an attack against a target within 5 feet of them as a free action. When they make this attack, they do so with advantage.

entries.name: Advanced Weaponry
entries: By 18th level, your access to futuristic and alien technology is truly unparalleled. You now have three Super Science devices, rather than two, that allow you to replicate a super power of your choice.
Furthermore, when you reach this level, you can now select 1st or 2nd level powers for your Super Science devices.
When you gain a Mastermind level, you can elect to change the superpowers these devices can use, selecting other 1st or 2nd level powers.

entries.name: Analytic Mastermind Strategy
entries: The Analytic Mastermind is always one step ahead of their foes, deducing their next move before the fact and identifying weaknesses on the fly. An Analytic Mastermind is an exceptionally potent force when coupled with other superpowered individuals to benefit from their insights.

entries.name: Computational Brilliance
entries: Analytic Masterminds are arguably the greatest minds in the world. When you choose the Analytic Mastermind Strategy, and you create your character at 1st level, your Intelligence score increases by 2.

entries.name: Absorb Knowledge
entries: Also at 1st level, you gain the ability to absorb information at an alarming rate. You can read the contents of a book in a matter of minutes and memorize a paragraph of text immediately. You also have a photographic memory and can recall things you have experienced with perfect accuracy within the past year.

entries.name: Predict Aggression
entries: Your analysis of behavior has granted you an insight into the origins of aggression. At 3rd level, you gain advantage on initiative rolls.
When you reach 13th level, your predictions come early enough that you can warn your allies. Any friendly creatures within 10 feet of you also have advantage on their initiative rolls.

entries.name: Foresee
entries: When you reach 6th level, your ability to predict danger increases. When you or an ally within 30 feet of you makes a save, you can use your reaction to communicate a warning, granting yourself and your allies advantage on that roll. You may use this reaction after the first save roll, but before the effect has been established.

entries.name: Anticipate Attack
entries: At 9th level, you've gained the ability to analyze your foes' tactics on the fly and can communicate this insight to your allies. As a bonus action, select a visible foe within 60 feet of you and then communicate what you have gleaned with your allies. You, and any ally who can hear and understand you, may act as if you all have increased cover against that foe until the end of your next turn. If you and your allies currently have no cover, you may act as if you have partial cover when calculating your AC or making saves. If you already have partial cover, you may act as if you have ¾ cover. If you already have ¾ cover, you may act as if you have total cover.

At 17th level, you can perform this analysis on all visible foes within 60 feet of you. Now, when you communicate your insights to your allies, you and they can act as if you have increased cover against attacks from all those foes

entries.name: Combatant Analysis
entries: When you reach 13th level, you become able to analyze a foe completely and communicate this insight to your allies. As an action, you can communicate a detailed analysis of the opponent's weak points to all allies who can hear and understand you, granting them advantage against that foe on their next attack before the beginning of your next turn.

entries.name: Infallible Model
entries: At 17th level, your ability to model possible futures rises to the level of prophecy—at least, that's how others perceive it, simply because they cannot understand the complexity of your equations. When anyone at the table must make an attack roll, skill check, or save, you can use your reaction to tell them not to roll, because you have already foreseen the outcome. You decide what the result of the roll is, though you must declare that you are replacing the roll with your prediction before the roll is made. Once you have replaced a roll in this way, you may not do so again until you complete a short or long rest, which allows you to compute a new mathematical model.

entries.name: Absolute Predestination
entries: When you reach 20th level, your ability to analyze and understand all the causes and effects around you reaches perfection. Now, when you roll for initiative and have already used your Infallible Model feature, you regain one use of it.

entries.name: Charismatic Mastermind Strategy
entries: Unlike the Analytic Mastermind, the Charismatic Mastermind might not have the almost prophetic wisdom of the Analytic, but they make up for it in sheer numbers, swarming their foes with followers who faithfully do their bidding. A villainous Charismatic Mastermind, might throw wave upon wave of low-level criminals at their enemies, sacrificing them mercilessly. A more noble and upstanding Charismatic, however, usually reserves their commands for drones or other non-sentient Minions. Either way though, you can easily overwhelm even superpowered foes.

entries.name: Magnetic Personality
entries: Charismatic Masterminds draw followers to them like no one else can. When you choose the Charismatic Mastermind Strategy, when you create your character at 1st level, your Charisma score increases by 2.

entries.name: Only Connect
entries: Also at 1st level, you gain the ability to connect with others with ease, disarming them with your charm. As an action, you can speak to one humanoid within 30 feet who can hear and understand you. If you continue to speak to the person, they treat you like a friendly acquaintance. They continue to do so until you stop speaking to them or until you or your companions do anything harmful to them, at which time they regard you as a polite stranger, though they may become suspicious depending on what occurred while you spoke.

entries.name: On NPC Interactions
entries: Features like the Charismatic Mastermind's Only Connect and Provoke, as well as powers like {@spell charm person}, cannot solve every social challenge. Indeed, many NPCs might come to view you as a friendly acquaintance after using these features, yet still deny your request. No good security guard would let an acquaintance who lacks proper ID though a checkpoint, for example. NPCs still stick to their duties and principles, even after such features are used.

entries.name: Bolster
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can support your friends with inspiring words. As a bonus action, you can speak to your Minions and allies. Any within 60 feet who can hear and understand you gain temporary HP equal to your Mastermind level.

entries.name: Provoke
entries: At 3rd level, you've learned how to get under someone's skin. As a bonus action, you can call out one creature within 60 feet who can see you, inciting them to violence against you. Until the end of your next turn, that creature has disadvantage on any attack roll that isn't against you, and if the creature hits a creature other than you with an attack, that creature has resistance to the damage dealt by the attack.

entries.name: Inspire
entries: By 6th level, you've become an inspirational figure. Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you must make a save, the creature gains a bonus to the save equal to your Charisma modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1). You must be conscious to grant this bonus.
At 17th level, the range of this bonus increases to 30 feet.

entries.name: Rally
entries: When you reach 6th level, your ability to motivate your friends increases. As an action, you utter inspiring words, urging your allies and Minions to greater heroics, either with words or deeds. Until the end of your next turn, all your allies within 30 feet can add your proficiency bonus to any attack roll, skill check, or save they make. Once you have rallied your allies in this way, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Contacts
entries: By the time you reach 9th level, you've amassed a substantial collection of contacts in a variety of industries, all of whom seem to owe you a favor. If you spend 1 hour on the phone, email, or other form of communication, you can acquire weapons, armor, ammunition, equipment, and other supplies up to a value of a month's rent, to be delivered when you complete your next short rest. You can also acquire the use of a civilian or commercial vehicle, including a helicopter, speed boat, commercial truck, or several luxury cars, in 24 hours. Once you have used this feature, you cannot do so again, for one week.

You may also tap your contacts to arrange for legal protection. Instead of acquiring equipment, your contacts can bail you and your friends out of jail, can arrange passage across an otherwise closed border, and similar legal advantages. They cannot have you exonerated for crimes or have charges dropped, however.

At 17th level, you can reach out to your contacts once a day rather than once a week. They can also arrange for you to have temporary diplomatic immunity, protecting you for 1 day from incarceration or prosecution. They cannot arrange such immunity more than once a month, however.

entries.name: Inspire Courage
entries: Starting at 9th level, you, and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be {@condition frightened} while you are conscious.
At 17th level, the range of this bonus increases to 30 feet.

entries.name: Taunt
entries: When you reach 13th level, you learn to target your enemy's psychological weaknesses. When a visible creature within 120 feet and who can hear and understand you misses with an attack, fails a skill check, or save, you can use your reaction to mock and humiliate them for their failure. The creature must make a Charisma save against your Power Save DC or be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. If they succeed on the save, the have disadvantage on their next roll before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Expanded Inspiration & Contacts
entries: When you reach 17th level, your ability to inspire expands. Your Inspire Resistance and Inspire Courage features extend to a range of 30 feet. Your Contacts feature can also be used once a day at this level, rather than once a week.

entries.name: Incredible Will
entries: When you reach 20th level, the power of your personality is overwhelming. Whenever must roll a Charisma skill check or save, you can treat the result as a natural 20. What's more, you cannot be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and have resistance to psychic damage.

And so it is that knowledge one has seems always insufficient for the heights to be achieved. I must have the tomes. The most expedient path forward is obtaining them from whence they've been scattered. So I search...

entries.name: {@class Mentalist|Superheroic5E}
entries: Whereas Kinetics channel their superheroic powers through the body, Mentalists manifest power through the mind. Some move objects with a thought, while others read and control the thoughts of others. Still other weave illusions in the minds of their foes.

Because their powers are largely mental, many Mentalists do not outwardly display their superpowers. Some do, of course, with glowing eyes or visible waves emanating from their forehead, but most appear mundane.
Mentalist heroes can be exceptionally dangerous. When you can throw your foe with a thought or force them to attack their allies, you can dominate a battle.

entries.name: Origin & Nature
entries: Many Mentalist superheroes have their powers innately, though some receive them through a transformative experience. Perhaps you were a peculiar child who always heard the thoughts of others. Or maybe your first time taking a hallucinogenic drug opened your third eye and granted you access to your powers. In any event, your mind has become a weapon.

entries.name: Creating an Mentalist
entries: Each Mentalist has their own aptitude which expresses the way their powers most commonly or impressively manifest. When making a Mentalist hero, choose a mental aptitude: {@b illusions}, {@b telekinesis}, or {@b telepathy}. Your choice of aptitude determines what some of your superpowers will be, as well as grants you special benefits in certain circumstances.

entries.name: Class Features
entries: As an Mentalist superhero, you gain the following class features.

entries.name: Hit Points
entries: {@bold Hit Dice}: {@dice 1d8} per level
{@bold Hit Points at 1st Level}: 18 + your Constitution modifier
{@bold Hit Points at Higher Levels}: {@dice 1d8} (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Mentalist level after 1st
{@bold Saving Throws}: Wisdom and Charisma

entries.name: Mental Aptitude
entries: You can use your mind to manipulate the world around you in superhuman ways. Choose a mental aptitude that captures the ways in which you use your powers: illusion, telekinesis, or telepathy. Each mental aptitude is detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you mental aptitude powers and other features when you choose it at 1st level. It also grants you additional benefits at 6th, 13th, and 20th levels.

entries.name: Mental Aptitude Powers
entries: Each focus has a list of powers that you gain at the Mentalist levels noted in the aptitude description. Once you gain an aptitude power, it doesn't count against the number of powers known.

entries.name: At Will Powers
entries: At 1st level, you know one at will power from the Mentalist power list or the General power list. You learn additional at will powers at higher levels, as shown in the at will powers column of the Mentalist table.

entries.name: Powers Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know 2 1st-level powers from the Mentalist or General power lists.
The Leveled Powers Known column of the Mentalist table shows when you learn more powers of your choice. Each of these powers must be of a level for which you have slots.

entries.name: Leveled Power Slots
entries: The Mentalist table shows how many slots you have for using your powers at each level. To use one of these powers, you must expend a slot of the power's level or higher. You regain all expended 1st through 8th level slots when you finish a short or long rest. You regain any expended 9th level power slots when you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Power Ability
entries: Charisma is your power ability for your superpowers since the strength of your powers flows from asserting your will over reality around you. You use your Charisma whenever a power refers to your power ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the save DC for a power you use and when making an attack roll with one.
{@b Power save DC =} 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
{@b Power attack modifier =} your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

entries.name: Mind Powers and Safety
entries: Many of the powers that Mentalists gain can be described as involving subtle social manipulation, like you might see an excellent salesperson do. Others, however, can be construed as invasive, gaslighting, and harmful to their targets. An effort was made to describe these powers in a way that allows for less harmful implementations, but each group of players should discuss their comfort level with such powers being used in advance of play, preferably as part of a Session Zero. Some groups are not bothered; others may limit such powers to villains; and still others may choose not to allow them at all. Doing whatever allows your group to have the most fun, which means respecting what every player finds comfortable and uncomfortable, is the goal of {@b S5E}. See Appendix 2 for more guidance.

entries.name: Empathy
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can provide aid and emotional support to others, either through encouraging words or by mentally boosting their mood. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear you. That creature gains one Empathy die, a {@dice d6}.

Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or save it makes. The creature can wait until after it rolls the {@dice d20} before deciding to use the Empathy die but must decide before the GM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the Empathy die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can have only one Empathy die at a time.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Your Empathy die changes when you reach certain levels in this class. The die becomes a {@dice d8} at 5th level, a {@dice d10} at 10th level, and a {@dice d12} at 15th level.

entries.name: Powerful Personality
entries: At 2nd level, a Mentalist's powers magnify the power of their personality. You have advantage on Charisma skill checks. Furthermore, you gain proficiency in {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Deception}, or {@skill Intimidation}. If you already have proficiency in it, you now have expertise. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency.

entries.name: Mental Resilience
entries: Also at 2nd level, you also develop a tougher psyche. You have resistance to psychic damage and advantage on saves against being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Reflexive Powers
entries: Starting at 3rd level, 1st-level power use is now reflexive for you. This means that you have a limitless supply of 1st-level power slots. If you wish to use abilities at higher level, however, you must expend a higher-level slot as normal.

As your heroes level up, the levels at which they can use their powers reflexively also increases. At 7th level, for example, 2nd-level power use is reflexive as well as 1st-level. [See "Reflexive Powers Use Example" sidebar on p. 25 in Chapter 3.]
Consult the chart above to see when heroes gain the ability to use higher-level powers reflexively.

entries.name: Font of Empathy
entries: Beginning when you reach 5th level, you regain all your expended uses of Empathy when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Subtle Power
entries: At 9th level, using your powers becomes second nature. Before, when you used your powers, you may have had a look of focus on your face; you may have put your hand to your temple or reached out at your target with a hand. Now, however, when you use your powers, there is no sign you are using them.

Furthermore, if you use a power to manipulate a person, you can leave the target unaware that a superpower is manipulating them, even after the effect has ended, though directing them to perform actions that are far outside of their normal behavior alerts them, and anyone who knows them, that something is wrong.

For example, if you use a suggestion power on someone, the target might recognize afterwards that they behaved uncharacteristically, but they would not know why, nor would they suspect it was you who had caused it. If you were the only person to encounter them that day, they might still suspect you, of course, but they would have no awareness of how you did it.

entries.name: Enhanced Concentration
entries: When you reach 10th level, you have advantage on rolls to maintain {@status concentration} on a power.

entries.name: Boundless Empathy
entries: At 20th level, when you roll initiative and have no uses of Empathy left, you regain one use

entries.name: Illusion Aptitude
entries: What you can imagine can be made real—well, real enough to fool the casual observer, at least. If you select illusion as your mental aptitude at 1st level, you gain the following features.

entries.name: Illusion Aptitude Powers
entries: Illusiomosts know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Simple Illusions
entries: When you choose the illusion mental aptitude at 1st level, you gain the {@spell minor illusion} at will power if you do not have it already. This at will power does not count against your total number of at will powers known.
When you use {@spell minor illusion}, its range and duration are doubled for you.

entries.name: Improved Illusions
entries: When you reach 6th level, your ability to create illusions grows. Now, when you use the {@spell minor illusion}, {@spell silent image}, or {@spell major image}, the range and duration are all multiplied by 10. What's more, {@spell silent image} and {@spell major image} no longer require {@status concentration} for you. You can now have up to three instances of these three powers active at once. If you use any of these three powers a fourth time, the oldest currently active use of the power ends.

entries.name: Mind Over Matter
entries: At 13th level, you can lend your illusions a degree of reality. Each time you use {@spell minor illusion}, {@spell silent image}, {@spell major image}, or {@spell hallucinatory terrain}, you can choose one inanimate object or terrain feature in the illusion and make it real. It remains real for as long as the illusion lasts, or until 1 hour has passed, whichever is shorter. For example, you could create an illusory car with silent image, make it real, and then drive it across town.

These illusions cannot deal damage directly. Thus, if you crashed your illusory car into someone, it would not deal damage. The illusions can deal damage indirectly, however, so someone falling off a building and hitting the illusory car still takes falling damage

entries.name: Master of Illusions
entries: At 20th level, whenever you use one of the powers on the Illusion Aptitude Powers list, you can decide who will see your illusions and who will not. Select a number of people who are in range to see or hear the effect, then choose whether those people are the only ones in range who can see or hear the effect, or who cannot see or hear it. For example, you could create an image in a crowded room and have only two people see it, or you could have those two people be the only ones who cannot see it—your choice.

entries.name: Telekinesis Aptitude
entries: With a thought, you can move matter. If you select telekinesis as your mental aptitude at 1st level, you gain the following features

entries.name: Telekinesis Aptitude Powers
entries: Telekinetics know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Simple Telekinesis
entries: When you choose the telekinesis mental aptitude at 1st level, you gain the {@spell mage hand|phb|telekinetic hand} at will power if you do not have it already. This at will power does not count against your total number of at will powers known. When you use {@spell mage hand|phb|telekinetic hand}, its range, weight limit, and duration is doubled for you.

entries.name: Enhanced Telekinesis
entries: When you reach 6th level, your ability to use telekinetic powers grows. Now, when you use the {@spell mage hand|phb|telekinetic hand}, the range, weight limit, and duration are all multiplied by 10. Thus, {@spell mage hand|phb|telekinetic hand} can now lift up to 200 lb. at 600 feet for 20 minutes.
Furthermore, you can now have up to three instances of this power active at once. If you use the power a fourth time, the oldest currently active use of the power ends.

entries.name: Autotelekinetic
entries: At 13th level, you are always under the effect of the {@spell fly} power, no {@status concentration} required

entries.name: Ultimate Telekinesis
entries: At 20th level, whenever you use the {@spell lesser telekinesis|Superheroic5E}, {@spell telekinesis}, or {@spell greater telekinesis|Superheroic5E} powers, the weight limits, ranges, durations, and possible number of targets for these powers all triple.

entries.name: Telepathy Aptitude
entries: Your powers allow you to access the minds of others. Perhaps you hear their thoughts or see their memories. Regardless, your powers can be terrible indeed in the wrong hands.
If you select telepathy as your mental aptitude at 1st level, you gain the following features.

entries.name: Telepathy Aptitude Powers
entries: Telepaths know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Telepathic Communication
entries: When you choose the telepathy mental aptitude at 1st level, you gain the {@spell message} at will power if you do not have it already. This at will power does not count against your total number of at will powers known.
When you use the {@spell message} at will power, its range is doubled for you.

entries.name: Sense Others
entries: When you reach 6th level, your awareness of other minds becomes automatic. You automatically become aware of any creature with an Intelligence of 4 or higher within 60 feet of you who is not actively hiding. If they are attempting to hide, you have advantage to detect them.
This ability also allows you at times to sense people's intentions before they act on them. You have advantage on initiative.

entries.name: Enhanced Telepathy
entries: At 13th level, for your powers that do not have a range of self or touch, the ranges multiply by ten. For your powers with a duration longer than instantaneous or 1 round, the durations also multiply by ten.

entries.name: Master Telepathy
entries: When you reach 20th level, you are always under the effects of the {@spell mind blank} power.

entries.name: {@class Metamorph|Superheroic5E}
entries: Metamorphs are a diverse collection of heroes with strikingly different powers. Some can turn {@condition invisible}, others intangible; others merge with an alien symbiote; still others can adopt the appearance of other people; and a few can even stretch and alter their flesh in impossible ways.
There is one thing they all have in common, however; they all can perform fantastic feats by altering their bodies. When facing a Metamorph, it is hard to predict what threats you might encounter.

entries.name: Origin & Nature
entries: Metamorphs gain their powers in any number of ways. Perhaps you were born with the ability. Or maybe you gained your abilities when you were exposed to a strange substance that awakened you or transformed your body in remarkable and unexpected ways.

entries.name: Creating a Metamorph
entries: Metamorphs are surprisingly varied in their abilities, though they can be classed into rough categories. When making a Metamorph, choose a Transformation: {@b elasticity}, {@b intangibility}, {@b invisibility}, {@b polymorphing}, or {@b symbiosis}. Your choice of transformation determines what some of your superpowers will be, as well as grants you special benefits in certain circumstances.

entries.name: Class Features
entries: As an Metamorph superhero, you gain the following class features.

entries.name: Hit Points
entries: {@bold Hit Dice}: {@dice 1d10} per level
{@bold Hit Points at 1st Level}: 20 + your Constitution modifier
{@bold Hit Points at Higher Levels}: {@dice 1d10} (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per Martial Expert level after 1st
{@bold Saving Throws}: Constitution and Wisdom

entries.name: Metamorph Power
entries: You can alter and manipulate your body and its relationship to its environment, changing its shape, appearance, visibility, or location.

entries.name: At Will Powers
entries: At 1st level, you know two at will powers from the Metamorph power list or the General power list. You learn additional at will powers at higher levels, as shown in the at will powers column of the Metamorph table.

entries.name: Powers Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st level powers from the Metamorph or General power lists.
The Leveled Powers Known column of the Metamorph table shows when you learn more powers of your choice. Each of these powers must be of a level for which you have slots

entries.name: Leveled Power Slots
entries: The Metamorph table shows how many power slots are available for your powers at each level. To use one of these powers, you must expend a slot of the power's level or higher. You regain all expended 1st through 8th level slots when you finish a short or long rest. You regain any expended 9th level power slots when you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Power Ability
entries: Wisdom is your power ability for your superpowers because your powers depend upon your capacity to intuit your body, its form, and its position in space. You use your Wisdom whenever a power refers to your power ability.
In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the save DC for a power you use and when making an attack roll with one.
{@b Power save DC =} 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
{@b Power attack modifier =} your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

entries.name: Transformation
entries: You can alter your body in superhuman ways to accomplish amazing feats. Choose a transformation that captures the ways in which you use your powers: {@b elasticity}, {@b intangibility}, {@b invisibility}, {@b polymorphing}, or {@b symbiosis}.

Each transformation is detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you special features when you choose it at 1st level. It also grants you additional benefits at 6th, 13th, and 18th levels.

entries.name: Transformation Powers
entries: Each transformation has a list of powers that you gain at the Metamorph levels noted in the aptitude description. Once you gain a transformation power, it doesn't count against your total number of powers known.

entries.name: Adaptable
entries: A Metamorph's experiences in life can vary widely. At 2nd level, you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice. If you already have proficiency in the skill you choose, you now have expertise. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency.

entries.name: Bodily Control
entries: At 2nd level, your ability to manipulate your body develops. You gain the following features:

items: You can go five times longer than normal without food, water, or air.
You have advantage on saves to resist or recover from disease.
You have advantage on skill checks and saves to avoid or escape being {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}.
You regain the maximum number of HP for any Hit Die you spend.

entries.name: Reflexive Powers
entries: Starting at 3rd level, 1st-level power use is now reflexive for you. This means that you have a limitless supply of 1st-level power slots. If you wish to use abilities at higher level, however, you must expend a higher-level slot as normal.
As your heroes level up, the levels at which they can use their powers reflexively also increases. [See "Reflexive Powers Use Example" sidebar.]
Consult the chart above to see when heroes gain the ability to use higher-level powers reflexively.

entries.name: Recuperate
entries: At 5th level, your mastery over your own form allows you to recover from exertions more easily. As an action, you can remove one level of {@condition exhaustion}. Once you have used this feature, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Transformation Adept
entries: At 9th level, your mastery over your transformation powers increases. You can now use any power listed on your Transformation Power table that normally has a use time of 1 action as an action or a bonus action.

entries.name: Bodily Purity
entries: At 10th level, your innate connection to your body renders you immune to natural diseases and slows the aging process considerably. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.

entries.name: Bodily Mastery
entries: When you reach 15th level, your control over your physical form is complete. You gain the following features:

items: You are immune to the {@condition paralyzed} and {@condition petrified} conditions
You have advantage on rolls to avoid being shoved or knocked {@condition prone}
You are resistant to poison damage and have advantage on rolls to resist or end the {@condition poisoned} condition

entries.name: Metamorph Master
entries: Upon reaching 20th level, you can transform yourself like never before. Now, none of the powers listed on your Transformation Powers table require Concentration any longer for you. Their effects last the duration, though they can end early if you choose to end them or if you use the same power again.

entries.name: Elasticity Transformation
entries: You can radically change the shape of your body. Some elastic heroes have pliable, stretchy bodies, allowing them to reach across a room or grapple a foe. Other such heroes can take on virtually any size at all, shrinking down to the microscopic level or expanding to tower over buildings.

entries.name: Elasticity Transformation Powers
entries: Elastic Metamorphs know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Absorb Blow
entries: When you choose the elasticity transformation power at 1st level, your body becomes more resilient, able to bounce back more than usual.

When you take bludgeoning damage from a visible source (including falling), you can use your reaction to become momentarily rubbery, absorbing some of the kinetic energy. You have resistance to the triggering instance of bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Expanded Limited Elasticity
entries: When you reach 6th level, you can stretch yourself further than before. Now, when you use the {@spell limited elasticity|Superheroic5E} power, you can now reach 15 feet. Furthermore, when you use this power to create weapons from your limbs, they do {@damage 1d8} damage rather than {@dice 1d6}. Finally, the duration on this power grows to 10 minutes for you.

entries.name: Extended Elasticity
entries: When you reach 13th level, your ability to stretch expands. You gain the following benefits when you use your elasticity power:

items: you benefit from the effects of the {@spell freedom of movement} power
you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage
you can transform into a Small or Large shape as an action
your walking speed doubles
the duration extends to 1 hour

entries.name: Enhanced Enlarge/Reduce
entries: At 18th level, you can grow or shrink your size more effectively. Now, when you use the enhanced {@spell enlarge/reduce} power, you can increase or decrease your size by a factor of ten, growing from Medium to Gargantuan, or shrinking from Medium to microscopic, in a single round.

entries.name: Intangibility Transformation
entries: You can manipulate your body's atomic structure to be denser or lighter and, eventually, to become entirely insubstantial. Doing so allows you to walk through walls, materializing inside of otherwise impregnable vaults, for example.

Indeed, some intangibility Metamorphs use their powers in combat in startlingly effective ways, materializing weapons within foes or dragging them into solid objects. If you select intangibility as your transformation at 1st level, you gain the following features.

entries.name: Intangibility Transformation Powers
entries: Intangibility Metamorphs know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Light Step
entries: When you select the intangibility transformation at 1st level, you learn to soften and lighten your step. Your steps naturally make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across, and you leave no footprints behind. If you have the {@spell silent step|Superheroic5E} power, you can now use it as a bonus action, and the {@spell pass without trace} power does not require {@status concentration} for you; instead, it activates when you wish, and you can cause the effect to stop at will.

entries.name: Mist and Shadow
entries: At 6th level, when you use the {@spell gaseous form} power, your ability to take on a semi-tangible form improves. Now, you have a flying speed of 30 feet. What's more, you can now manipulate physical objects, but only in crude ways. You can throw a lever or turn a doorknob, but not type on a keyboard or wield a weapon. Finally, while in your gaseous form, you can take the hide action to become {@condition invisible} in dim light or darkness. You become visible again if you move into bright light.

entries.name: Shared Insubstantiality
entries: When you reach 13th level, you learn to use your {@spell momentary insubstantiality|Superheroic5E} and {@spell insubstantiality|Superheroic5E} powers on other people. You can now attempt to grapple solid creatures while remaining insubstantial. If you succeed, the target {@condition grappled} by you becomes insubstantial for as long as you can retain your grapple on them, though they can attempt to escape the grapple as normal.

If you choose to release them from your grapple, or if they escape, they become substantial again, possibly taking damage if they are within a solid object, as determined by the momentary insubstantiality power.
If the target is willing, no grappling check is necessary; this allows you to transport an ally through a locked door or wall, for example.

entries.name: Combat Insubstantiality
entries: At 18th level, you learn to use your insubstantiality powers on objects, as well as offensively. Now, when you are using your {@spell momentary insubstantiality|Superheroic5E} or {@spell insubstantiality|Superheroic5E} powers, you can pick up and drop solid objects. When you touch an object, you can normally lift that is not being worn or carried by someone else, you can choose to pick it up, rendering it insubstantial for as long as you carry it. When you release it, it returns to solid form.

You can use this offensively by releasing an insubstantial object inside of a foe. When an insubstantial object rematerializes, it falls to the ground where it is located. If part or all of an object rematerializes inside of a creature, the creature takes an amount of force damage determined by the size of the object that appears within them, as listed in the Materializing Object Damage table, instead of the damage listed with the insubstantiality powers. The object is then shunted to the nearest unoccupied space outside of the creature, unless the object is larger than the creature, in which case the creature is shunted instead.

entries.name: Invisibility Transformation
entries: You can manipulate your body so that you can hide or pass unseen more easily, or even turn entirely transparent. Some invisibility Metamorphs bend light around them subconsciously, while others alter their cellular structure to allow light to pass through them unimpeded.

Often, invisibility Metamorphs have other powers that allow them to go undetected beyond invisibility, making them very difficult to find. If you select invisibility as your transformation at 1st level, you gain the following features.

entries.name: Invisibility Transformation Powers
entries: Invisibility Metamorphs know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Sneaky
entries: When you choose this transformation at 1st level, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill, if you don't have it yet. If you do have it, you now have expertise. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency.

entries.name: Disappearing
entries: At 6th level, going unnoticed becomes second nature for you. You can {@action Hide} as a bonus action. When you do, you have advantage on any {@skill Stealth} check you make until the beginning of your next turn.

entries.name: Incognito
entries: At 13th level, your ability to remain unnoticed extends to new heights. People who meet you briefly now are unable to remember any identifying details about you, unless they are actively trying to observe and remember you, or if you want to allow yourself to be remembered.

You also have an uncanny sense for where security cameras and other devices are. You always seem to be looking away or just behind another person, and so on, so that you somehow manage to avoid being recorded clearly.

entries.name: Perfect Concealment
entries: When you reach 18th level, you can now hide even massive objects and crowds of people. When you use the concealment power, you can conceal an object that fits within a 300-foot cube—enough to hide a small city block.
And when you use the {@spell mass invisibility|Superheroic5E} power, you can obscure up to 30 people rather than six, and the duration of the power is 1 hour.

entries.name: Polymorphing Transformation
entries: You can instantly change your appearance. Some polymorphing heroes take on the appearance of others, infiltrating their enemies, while others alter their forms to have animal claws, gills, wings, and more. Finally, because of the evolving nature of their bodies, polymorphing heroes often can heal themselves at extraordinary rates.

entries.name: Polymorphing Transformation Powers
entries: Polymorphing Metamorphs know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries: When you choose the polymorphing transformation at 1st level, you become adept at imitating others. You now have proficiency in {@skill Performance} if you did not have it already. If you do have it, you now have expertise. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency.
What's more, you can mimic the speech and accent of a person whom you have listened to for at least 1 minute.

entries.name: Improved Disguise Self
entries: At 6th level, when you use the {@spell disguise self} power, people who try to discern that you are disguised have disadvantage on their {@skill Investigation} checks.

entries.name: Improved Alter Self
entries: When you reach 13th level, your ability to alter your form improves. Now, when you use the {@spell alter self} power, you no longer need to maintain {@status concentration}. For you, the power now has a duration of 1 hour, but you can end the effect early if you choose.

entries.name: Forensic Transformation
entries: When you reach 18th level, your ability to mimic others reaches a new level of detail. When you use the {@spell alter self} or {@spell superior alter self|Superheroic5E} powers, you can change your fingerprints, erasing yours entirely or even mimicking someone else's if you have had a chance to study them carefully for ten minutes. Furthermore, you can alter your physiology enough to trick biometric scanners, modifying your retinas, heart rate, and even blood type.

entries.name: Symbiosis Transformation
entries: When you take the Symbiosis subclass, you determine that your Metamorph abilities are the result of an alien, extradimensional, or otherwise peculiar entity merging with you. Perhaps this entity is {@condition invisible}, hidden inside you, until it emerges to lash out at your foes. Or perhaps your symbiote is visible, attached to the back of your spine, and generating powers around you. Regardless, your symbiote provides you with many impressive and original powers.

Your symbiote is bonded with you and cannot normally be removed. Only through exceptional narrative means, and {@i with the consent of the player}, may a GM separate hero from symbiote, though some higher-level abilities allow the player to choose to separate host from symbiote. Separating the two effectively renders the hero a mundane human and the symbiote a slowly dying being. Such situations aside, the symbiosis hero effectively functions as a single being.

entries.name: Symbiosis Transformation
entries: Polymorphing Metamorphs know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Telepathic Experience
entries: When you choose the symbiosis transformation at 1st level, host and symbiote become inextricably linked. You both can communicate telepathically at will.

The symbiote brings a set of unusual experiences and perspectives as well, which benefit you. Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Mystic}, {@skill Science}, {@skill Survival}, or {@skill Technology}. You now have proficiency in this skill if you did not already, thanks to your symbiote.

entries.name: Symbiote Climbing
entries: At 1st level, your symbiote assists you in moving on vertical surfaces. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Symbiotic Combat
entries: At 6th level, the symbiote begins to assert itself more forcefully to protect and support its host, participating directly in combat. When you make a weapon or power attack on your turn, you can use a bonus action to make a melee attack against a target within 10 feet of you, as a symbiotic tentacle erupts from you and strikes a target. Make a melee power attack against the target; on a hit, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your power ability modifier. When you reach 14th level, the tentacle damage increases to {@dice 3d8} plus your power ability modifier.

Furthermore, when you are hit by a visible attack, you can use your reaction to generate a symbiotic shield to absorb some of the damage. When you do so, you reduce the amount of damage by your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Symbiotic Tentacles
entries: When you reach 13th level, your symbiote can extend its presence far beyond your body while remaining joined with the host.
As a bonus action, you can extend one symbiotic tentacle up to 30 feet. As a part of this and subsequent bonus actions, the tentacle can do the following things:

items: take the {@action Use an Object} action as a bonus action, both when you produce the tentacle and on subsequent turns
swing from structures as if from a grappling hook
attempt to grapple foes or
make melee attacks as a bonus action, the same as with your Symbiotic Combat feature.
Your tentacle can reach around corners and behind cover.

entries: You can produce up to three such tentacles. When you take your bonus action to use your tentacles, you may only use one tentacle to make an attack; the other tentacles may instead use objects, attempt to grapple foes, and so on.

Your tentacles are a part of you, so when they take damage, you do. Nevertheless, they are resistant to all damage. If one is severed completely, it shrivels up and disappears, leaving only a residue behind.

entries.name: Symbiotic Independence
entries: When you reach 18th level, your symbiote gains the ability to leave its host and move around on its own. You control both the symbiote and the host when this occurs.

When the two separate, the symbiote and host both use your statistics, except that each has half of the HP, rounded down, that you had at the time of separation, and neither can use any powers until they rejoin. Also, the symbiote retains your climbing speed whereas the host loses it, while the symbiote loses the ability to speak and the host retains it. Finally, the symbiote can squeeze through spaces as small as one inch.

If either the symbiote or the host fall to zero HP, but remain alive, the other gains three levels of {@condition exhaustion} and must immediately make its way back to the other. If they manage to enter the same space, they combine their total HP and regain consciousness but retain the levels of {@condition exhaustion}.
I shall name it The Ring and they shall serve my purposes so that they seem to be serving themselves...

entries.name: {@class Mystic|Superheroic5E}
entries: Elemental heroes tap fundamental forces and elements of the universe, like gravity or heat. Mystic heroes, however, access powers more eldritch and arcane, but no less real and potent.

Whereas Elementalists might shoot ice or light, the Mystics, on the other hand, use subtler, stranger methods. Some are witches, hexing foes, while others study the ways of the arcane. A few deal with the spirits, perhaps even with archetypes like Life or Death itself. These eerie powers make Mystic heroes uncanny and unpredictable.

entries.name: Origin & Nature
entries: Some Mystic heroes are born into their power, inheriting it from an ancient bloodline or being born under the right astrological signs. Many more, however, gain access through study and sacrifice. Perhaps you dedicated years of your life to studying ancient grimoires and practicing spells. Or maybe you serve an entity from beyond space and time. Indeed, you might even have had to sacrifice something valuable—love, life, knowledge—to gain your abilities.
However, you gained them, you now possess dark and mysterious powers at your fingertips.

entries.name: Creating a Mystic
entries: Mystics are each unique in many ways, but they can be grouped into three kinds. When making a Mystic hero, choose a mystic path to walk; {@b arcane}, {@b eldritch}, or {@b primordial}. Arcane heroes study the laws and practices of magic; eldritch Mystics embrace eerie, supernatural forces fell and strange; and primordial Mystic heroes channel the fundamental energies of life and death. Your choice of mystic path determines what some of your superpowers will be, as well as grants you special benefits in certain circumstances.

entries.name: Class Features
entries: As an Mystic superhero, you gain the following class features.

entries.name: Hit Points
entries: {@bold Hit Dice}: {@dice 1d8} per level
{@bold Hit Points at 1st Level}: 18 + your Constitution modifier
{@bold Hit Points at Higher Levels}: {@dice 1d8} (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Martial Expert level after 1st
{@bold Saving Throws}: Intelligence and Charisma

entries.name: Mystic Power
entries: At 1st level, your studies have granted you access to another plane of existence, one from which you can draw power.

entries.name: At Will Powers
entries: At 1st level, you know two at will powers from the Mystic or General power lists. You learn additional at will powers at higher levels, as shown in the at will powers column of the Mystic table.

entries.name: Powers Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level powers from the Mystic or General power lists.
The Leveled Powers Known column of the Mystic table shows when you learn more powers of your choice. Each of these powers must be of a level for which you have slots.

entries.name: Leveled Power Slots
entries: The Mystic table shows how many power slots are available for your powers at each level. To use one of these powers, you must expend a slot of the power's level or higher. You regain all expended 1st through 8th level slots when you finish a short or long rest. You regain any expended 9th level power slots when you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Power Ability
entries: Intelligence is your power ability for your superpowers since your access to power occurs through study and the comprehension of challenging truths. Use your Intelligence skill whenever a power refers to your power ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the save DC for a power you use and when making an attack roll with one.
{@b Power save DC =} 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
{@b Power attack modifier =} your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

entries.name: Mystic Path
entries: Which path you walk in your practice determines the nature of your powers. At 1st level, you must select your path: {@b arcane}, {@b eldritch}, or {@b primordial}. Your choice grants you several unique abilities, as well as features at 1st level and again at 6th, 10th, and 18th level. The three path choices are described near the end of the Mystic class description, before the list of invocations.

entries.name: Mystic Path Powers
entries: Each path has a list of powers that you gain at the Mystic levels noted in the path description. Once you gain a path power, it doesn't count against the number of powers known.

entries.name: Invocations
entries: In your study of occult lore or perhaps in your connection to your Mystic practices, you have unearthed Mystic invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding superpowered ability.

At 2nd level, you gain two mystic invocations of your choice. Your invocation options are detailed at the end of the class description. When you gain certain Mystic levels, you gain additional invocations of your choice, as shown in the Invocations Known column of the Mystic table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the invocations you know and replace it with another invocation that you could learn at that level.
The list of available invocations can be found at the end of the Mystic class description, below.

entries.name: Supernatural Knowledge
entries: When you reach 2nd level, you gain proficiency in the Mystic skill. If you already have proficiency in it already, you now have expertise. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency.

entries.name: Mystic Boon
entries: At 3rd level, your otherworldly source of power bestows a gift upon you for your loyal service or because of your growing connection. You gain one of the features below. Each of these choices grants an additional feature at 9th, 15th, and 20th levels.

When you reach 3rd level, you must choose which boon you wish to receive. The Boon of the Tome has a scholarly focus, as the hero comes to learn a little bit about a wide variety of different powers. The Boon of the Avatar, however, concentrates your connection to your specific mystic path. In picking between the two, ask if you'd rather have a wide range of low-level powers from different sources, or if you'd prefer to focus and specialize in your chosen superpower profile, becoming exceptional at it

entries.name: Boon of the Tomb
entries: You study the art of the arcane, becoming a dilettante of a wide variety of magics hidden and dangerous. You create a Mystical Text—perhaps a grimoire, scroll, or other form of text. When you gain this feature, choose three at will powers from any superpower list (the three needn't be from the same list). While the book is on your person, you can use those powers at will. They don't count against your number of at will powers known.

If you lose your Mystic Book, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your source of power. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.
In addition, you become more emersed in the occult. When you make a Mystic check, you roll with advantage.

At 9th level, you receive an additional mystic boon. you may add two 1st or 2nd level powers from any superpower list to your Mystical Text. As long as you have your Mystical Text with you, these powers count as reflexive powers for you. You cannot expend power slots to use these powers at higher levels, however. They don't count against your total number of powers known.

When you reach 15th level, your Mystical Text imbues you with the wisdom of the ages. Now, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

At 20th level, your familiarity with all forms of superpowered and supernatural energies is unparalleled. With great effort, you can now capture and redirect superpowered attacks. When you are targeted with a superpower by a visible foe who is within 60 feet, you can use your reaction to reflect the power back at the original power user, as though you had used the power yourself. If the reflected power requires an attack roll or save, those rolls must be made using your power attack modifier or save DC.
This takes massive effort, however, so, once you have done this, you cannot do again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Boon of the Avatar
entries: Your contact with otherworldly forces is more than just scholarly; it is immersive. As such, you gradually come to embody more and more of your mystic path, until you truly become a specialist in your power.

When you gain this feature, you may select an additional at will power and an additional 1st level power from the Mystic power list. These powers do not count against your numbers of at will or leveled powers known. When you use the 1st level power, you must still expend a slot as normal.

At 9th level, channeling your Mystic powers bolsters you. When you use a power from your mystic path powers table, you gain temporary HP equal to your proficiency bonus. Furthermore, when you use a power listed in your Mystic path powers table that requires an attack roll or save, you may add +1 to the attack roll or save DC.

When you reach 15th level, the power flowing through you reinforces your existing strengths. Choose two skills you have proficiency in. When you roll these skills, you may add double your proficiency bonus.

At 20th level, you truly become the apotheosis of your Mystic path. When you use a power from your mystic path powers table that requires an attack roll or save, you may roll a {@dice 1d4 + 1}, rather than the +1 you gained at 9th level, and add it to the attack roll or power save DC.

entries.name: Reflexive Powers
entries: Starting at 3rd level, 1st-level power use is now reflexive for you. This means that you have a limitless supply of 1st-level power slots. If you wish to use abilities at higher level, however, you must expend a higher-level slot as normal.
As your heroes level up, the levels at which they can use their powers reflexively also increases. [See "Reflexive Powers Use Example" sidebar.]
Consult the chart above to see when heroes gain the ability to use higher-level powers reflexively

entries.name: Third Eye
entries: When you reach 5th level, your connection to otherworldly energies grants you the ability to see things no one else can see. You now have {@sense darkvision} to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, its range extends by 60 feet. You can see in darkness as if the darkness were dim light, though you cannot discern color, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Eerie Trance
entries: At 13th level, you can enter a meditative trance, gaining insight and protection. If you remain {@condition prone} with a speed of zero, you gain the benefit of the see invisibility, force armor, and sanctuary powers, even if you do not know these powers, as well as {@sense blindsight} to a range of 10 feet.

entries.name: Mystic Paths
entries: There are many arcane, primordial, and eldritch paths one might walk, and many otherworldly fonts of power that mortals might tap. The paths here briefly describe several such practices.

entries.name: Arcane Mystic Path
entries: Perhaps you study the ancient ways of the arcane, reading spells in dusty tomes and manipulating the fundamental principles of reality. You may know the true names of things, the forbidden words in the first language, or the sigils of power to unmake and alter the seams of existence. Maybe you draw mandalas, practice alchemy, or meditate on higher planes of existence. Whatever your technique, you perform miraculous, magical, mystical acts beyond the reach of mundane mortals.

entries.name: Arcane Path Powers
entries: Arcane Mystic know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Esoteric Research
entries: When you choose to walk this path at 1st level, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Investigation} skill. If you already have it, you gain expertise. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency.
You additionally have advantage on rolls to detect superpowered individuals within 30 feet of you, as their nature causes ripples in the energies ebbing and flowing around you.

entries.name: Intimations of the Future
entries: When you reach 6th level, your attunement to the fabric of reality allows you to detect ripples of events yet to come. When you are targeted by an attack by a visible foe, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on their attack roll.

entries.name: Hermetic Ward
entries: At 10th level, your study of the arcane allows you to generate a protective field of magical energy around you. Whenever you spend 1 minute in meditation or complete a short or long rest, you gain temporary HP equal to your Mystic level.
As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can share your ward with them. Once the ward's temporary HP are depleted, damage is dealt to the creature as normal.

entries.name: Sight Beyond Sight
entries: When you reach 18th level, your contact with the threads of reality around you reaches a pinnacle. You are now under the effect of the {@spell true seeing} power at all times, even if you do not know the power.

entries.name: Eldrich Mystic Path
entries: Some things were not meant to be known by feeble human minds; some beings lie beyond what can be conceived. These unnamable entities sometimes brush against human experience, shattering and warping it irrevocably. Your source of power may be one such and you are forever changed. Or perhaps, rather than having an ineffable eldritch entity as your origin, you instead walk a witchy path, connecting to the peculiar and the mysterious here on Earth. Maybe you have tapped into dark powers through incantation and spell. Either way, you walk on the darker, stranger side of things and draw power from a source that would terrify others.

entries.name: Eldrich Path Powers
entries: Eldrich Mystic know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: When you choose this path at 1st level, you gain an otherworldly companion. This companion takes the form of a common animal but is in fact an instantiation of your eldritch practices. You now know the {@spell find familiar} power. The spell doesn't count against your number of powers known.

When you use this power, you can choose from a wider range of creatures. You can select any non-humanoid creature with a challenge rating of ½ or lower. Additionally, when you take the {@action Attack} action, you can forgo one of your own attacks to allow your familiar to make one attack of its own with its reaction

entries.name: Eerie Aura
entries: At 6th level, your connection to eldritch forces grants you an unsettling countenance. You now have advantage on saves against the {@condition frightened} condition.

Furthermore, as an action, you can emanate a sense of dread or deep discomfort. Every creature within 30 feet of you must make a Charisma save against your power save DC or be {@condition frightened} until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Empowered Familiar
entries: When you reach 10th level, your eldritch connection to your familiar grows. Now, the range out to which you can now telepathically communicate with your familiar extends to the whole planet.

As an action, you can also switch places with your familiar while you are in telepathic communication with it (assuming there is room for you at the familiar's location). Once you have used this ability, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Impossible Knowledge
entries: When you reach 18th level, you connection to the uncanny or otherworldly realms have fully permeated your being, granting you insights into things you could not possibly know.
As an action, you can use the legend lore power without expending a slot even if you do not know the power, and even if the target is not of great importance.

entries.name: Primordial Mystic Path
entries: You may receive your powers from a being that embodies some aspect of Life or Death itself. Or perhaps you embody the force of vitality or entropy that decays and disassembles everything in the universe. Despite what some might think, these origins are not inherently good or evil, as the passage from birth to death befalls all beings. The path you walk may be one in service to a pantheon of gods, a worship of nature, or communion with Life itself. On the other hand, you might serve a psychopomp who ferries the dead to the afterlife or be able to access the natural entropy of the universe. Whatever the nature of your path, you connect and commune with a primordial force of life and death in a way no others can.

entries.name: Primordial Path Powers
entries: Primordial Mystic know the following powers, which do not count toward their total number of powers known.

entries.caption: Primordial Path Powers
rows: {@spell chill of the grave|Superheroic5E}, {@spell bestow curse}

entries: When you choose this path at 1st level, you gain access to the raw forces of life or death. Choose either radiant or necrotic damage. You have resistance to this kind of damage.

Further, you know the {@spell primordial flame} at will power. This power does not count toward your total number of at will powers known. When you use this power, you deal the damage type you chose to be resistant to.

entries.name: Vitality Siphon
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to tap the flow of life force as it slips away. When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 HP, you gain temporary HP equal to your Intelligence modifier + your Mystic level (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Apprentice of Life and Death
entries: When you reach 10th level, your attunement to life and death strengthens. You have advantage on death saves.
You are now also immune to the damage type you chose as your Primordial Affinity at 1st level.

entries.name: Avatar of Life and Death
entries: At 18th level, you achieve mastery over the powers of mortality. You no longer need to eat, drink, or breathe and you have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saves against the {@condition poisoned} condition.
Finally, when you drop to 0 HP, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you have used this ability, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.
